query: After putting B and C in D,then put A in D.What happens to A?

original_scene.description: A is a piece of broccoli. B is a cup of dry ice. C is a cup of alcohol. D is an empty plastic cup.

key_step_1.conclusion: Take an appropriate amount of C and pour it into D, then put B into D. When B and C come into contact, B sublimes rapidly, absorbing heat and generating a large amount of gas, which causes the temperature of D to drop sharply.

key_step_2.conclusion: A contains a lot of water.

key_step_3.conclusion: Put A into D for a while. Take A out of D. As the temporature in D is low and the water in A freezes, A becomes very brittle.

subject: thermodynamics
